oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tribute to the Country Music Hall of Fame Reel #2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Tex Ritter (host) and Eddy Arnold (host) introducing Country Music Hall of Fame members: Red Foley (musician), Bob Wills (musician), Joseph Lee Frank (promoter/manager), Bill Monroe (musician), Steve Sholes (record executive), Gene Autry (musician), Fred Rose (songwriter), Tex Ritter (musician), Jim Reeves (musician), and Jim Davis (actor). The musician members listed are succeeded by performances. The tape was produced by Ralph Emery in WSM Radio Studios. The reel was issued February 09, 1968.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Bob Wills; Joseph L. Frank; Bill Monroe; Steve Sholes; Gene Autry; Fred Rose; Tex Ritter; Jim Reeves; Jim Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tex Ritter introduces Red Foley as one of the most versatile artists ever -- (00:58) Peace in the Valley (Red Foley) -- (03:52) Ritter introduces Bob Wills as the 'King of Western Swing' -- (04:53) San Antonio Rose (Bob Wills) -- (07:37) Ritter introduces the compassionate styling of Joseph L. Frank -- (08:40) Ritter introduces 'the father of Bluegrass Music' Bill Monroe -- (09:36) Blue Moon of Kentucky (Bill Monroe) -- (12:31) Ritter introduces Steve Sholes while discussing his time on the CMA board -- (13:40) Ritter introduces Gene Autry's world-wide acclaim -- (14:35) Back in the Saddle Again (Gene Autry) -- (17:25) Ritter reflects on the guiding nature of Fred Rose -- (18:22) Eddy Arnold introduces Ritter's country music accomplishments -- (19:15) Hillbilly Heaven (Tex Ritter) -- (22:21) Ritter introduces Jim Reeves while discussing Reeves' style [low level] -- (23:16) He'll Have to Go [low level] (Jim Reeves) -- (25:27) Arnold discusses Jim Davis' rural roots -- (26:20) You Are My Sunshine (Jim Davis)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Wills, Bob, 1905-1975; Frank, J. L. (Joseph Lee), 1900-1952; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Sholes, Stephen Henry; Autry, Gene, 1907-1998; Rose, Fred; Rose, Fred, 1897-1954; Ritter, Tex; Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Reeves, Jim; Davis, James P., -1963;
